text: David Henry Richmond (born 1938?, Brighton, Sussex), is a professional bass player, best known as a founder member of the 1960s pop group Manfred Mann, playing with the band in 1963.Strong, Martin C. (2003) The Great Rock Discography, Canongate, , p. 648 After leaving the band in 1963, Richmond became a session player, working with, amongst others, Elton John, Bread, Hank Marvin and Serge Gainsbourg. ==References== ==External links== * Jazz4now - The Dave Richmond Home Page Category:1930s births Category:Living people Category:People from Brighton Category:British rock bass guitarists Category:British double-bassists Category:Male double-bassists Category:Manfred Mann members Category:British rhythm and blues boom musicians Category:Year of birth uncertain Category:21st-century double-bassists
title: Dave Richmond
